title: New: Vondelpark – Dracula
content:
The last time I saw Lewis Rainsbury from Vondelpark he was excitedly telling me that the LP was finally finished, in his words, “I think you’ll like it”.

That was the last I heard of the upcoming record, at least from the band themselves. In the months that followed we’ve seen a series of remixes from the three-piece, an unprecedented amount actually, especially from a band that have shied away from the whole process. Dracula is our first taste of the LP, due out on R&S in spring 2013, a mournful yet uplifting love song that manages to be both tragic and exuberantly wistful in its convictions. In fact, wistful or indeed sublime, are 2 words that finally have a part to play in the description of Vondelpark’s music. The heady haze of the bedroom still acts as a backdrop to their world, only this this time the curtains have been opened, allowing bright city lights to finally enter the cave.

[from Seabed; out in spring 2013 via R&S]
